summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein on federal charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors. It alleges Epstein, with the help of employees and associates, sexually exploited dozens of underage girls between 2002 and 2005 in New York and Florida, using a scheme where victims were paid to recruit other minors.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor announcing the federal charges against Epstein.
Sweeney, as FBI Assistant Director, co-announced the arrest and charges, indicating the FBI's investigative role against Epstein.
The indictment alleges Epstein worked with employees and associates to contact victims, schedule encounters, and facilitate the abuse.
Epstein is accused of sexually exploiting dozens of underage girls, paying them for sex acts, and paying some to recruit other victims.
The indictment describes a scheme where certain victims were paid by Epstein to recruit additional underage girls into the network.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and a federal indictment was unsealed charging him with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Alleged Sex Trafficking Operation
events.description: Epstein allegedly sexually exploited dozens of underage girls, operating a scheme where victims were recruited for 'massages' that escalated to sex acts at his residences in New York and Florida. He paid victims and used some to recruit others.

locations: Manhattan, New York (location of federal court)
New York, New York (specifically, Epstein's Upper East Side mansion, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Palm Beach, Florida (location of Epstein's estate, referred to as the 'Palm Beach Residence')
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was federally charged with one count of sex trafficking of minors (max 40 years) and one count of conspiracy to engage in sex trafficking of minors (max 5 years).
The alleged criminal conduct occurred from at least 2002 through 2005, involving dozens of underage victims, some as young as 14.

Epstein allegedly operated a scheme where victims were initially recruited for 'massages' that became sexual, and he paid certain victims to recruit other underage girls, creating a 'vast network' of victims.
The abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in Manhattan, New York, and Palm Beach, Florida, with employees and associates helping to facilitate the encounters.
The press release includes contact information for potential victims to reach the U.S. Attorney's Office's Victim & Witness Services.
